thread.title: Why Did Datavault AI Plunge 10.89% Amid Bearish Forecasts?

author: Before the Bell
title: Why Did Datavault AI Plunge 10.89% Amid Bearish Forecasts?
text:
AInvest Newsletter
Daily stocks & crypto headlines, free to your inbox
- Datavault AI's stock plunged 10.89% in pre-market trading on August 21, 2025, driven by bearish forecasts and technical indicators.
- A 38.09 RSI reading and downward-moving averages signal oversold conditions, with price projections pointing to a potential $0.27296 level by year-end.
- Q2 2025 revenue surged 467% to $1.7 million, but 2025 earnings forecasts predict a $1.88/share loss amid ongoing operational challenges.
- Despite 2025 H2-$40M 2026 revenue targets, immediate bearish sentiment persists, urging caution for investors in current market conditions.
On August 21, 2025, Datavault AI experienced a significant drop of 10.89% in pre-market trading, reflecting a bearish sentiment among investors.
Datavault AI's stock has been under pressure due to a series of bearish forecasts and technical indicators. The company's stock is expected to continue its downward trend, with predictions suggesting a potential drop to as low as $0.27296 by the end of 2025. This bearish outlook is supported by various technical indicators, including moving averages and the Relative Strength Index (RSI), which currently stands at 38.09, indicating oversold conditions.
Recent financial reports from Datavault AI have shown mixed results. The company reported a 467% year-over-year increase in revenue for the second quarter of 2025, reaching $1.7 million. However, earnings are expected to remain negative, with projections indicating a loss of $1.88 per share for the coming year. Despite these challenges, Datavault AI has set ambitious revenue targets, aiming for $12-15 million in the second half of 2025 and $40-50 million in 2026.
Investors are advised to exercise caution when considering Datavault AI's stock, as the current market conditions and technical indicators suggest a continued downward trend. The company's ambitious revenue targets may provide some optimism, but the immediate outlook remains bearish.
